intro: Eremogone globuliflora, commonly known as the globular eremogone, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is typically found growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Eremogone globuliflora is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and drought tolerance.
